items.author: Shawn Levy
items.content: With its sweet soul and sharp mind, it's one of the most heartening films of the year.

items.author: David Ansen
items.content: Gus Van Sant, working from the tangy, well-written script, gets so much humor, grit and emotional truth out of this tale that the familiar formulas behind it simply fall away.

items.author: Emanuel Levy
items.content: This beautifully realized tale is always engaging and often quite touching.

items.author: Ann Hornaday
items.content: Fairly bursts with the exuberance and youthful energy that must have attended its creation.

items.author: James Berardinelli
items.content: An ordinary story told well. Taken as a whole, there's little that's special about this tale -- it follows a traditional narrative path, leaves the audience with a warm, fuzzy feeling, and never really challenges or surprises us.

items.author: Roger Ebert
items.content: It's the individual moments, not the payoff, that make it so effective.

items.author: Jami Bernard
items.content: You'd never guess this just-off-center movie was directed by indie hero Gus Van Sant. Maybe, like Will, he's casual about his gifts and feels no need to trot them out.

items.author: Marc Savlov
items.content: Part character study, part redemptive drama, and all cheesy heart, it's Boston-baked melodrama, a little too gooey at times, but still pretty delicious.

items.author: David Sterritt
items.content: Matt Damon and Robin Williams give touching performances, but Gus Van Sant's filmmaking is surprisingly ordinary.

items.author: Keith Phipps
items.content: Van Sant's direction is surprisingly static and conventional, which doesn't help this earnest, underwhelming misfire.
